00092 /* slot type arrays are terminated by the last member
00093  * having a slot type of 0 */
00094 enum {
00095     BMO_OP_SLOT_SENTINEL = 0,
00096     BMO_OP_SLOT_BOOL = 1,
00097     BMO_OP_SLOT_INT = 2,
00098     BMO_OP_SLOT_FLT = 3,
00099 
00100     /* normally store pointers to object, scene,
00101      * _never_ store arrays corresponding to mesh elements with this */
00102     BMO_OP_SLOT_PNT = 4,
00103     BMO_OP_SLOT_MAT = 5,
00104     BMO_OP_SLOT_VEC = 8,
00105 
00106     /* after BMO_OP_SLOT_VEC, everything is dynamically allocated arrays.
00107      * We leave a space in the identifiers for future growth.
00108      *
00109      * it's very important this remain a power of two */
00110     BMO_OP_SLOT_ELEMENT_BUF = 9, /* list of verts/edges/faces */
00111     BMO_OP_SLOT_MAPPING = 10 /* simple hash map */
00112 };
00113 #define BMO_OP_SLOT_TOTAL_TYPES 11
00114 
00115 /* please ignore all these structures, don't touch them in tool code, except
00116  * for when your defining an operator with BMOpDefine.*/

00118 typedef struct BMOpSlot {
00119     int slottype;
00120     int len;
00121     int flag;
00122     int index; /* index within slot array */
00123     union {
00124         int i;
00125         float f;
00126         void *p;
00127         float vec[3];
00128         void *buf;
00129         GHash *ghash;
00130     } data;
00131 } BMOpSlot;

00145     struct MemArena *arena;
00146 } BMOperator;

00165 /* ensures consistent normals before operator execution,
00166  * restoring the original ones windings/normals afterwards.
00167  * keep in mind, this won't work if the input mesh isn't
00168  * manifold.*/

00194 
00195 /*---------formatted operator initialization/execution-----------*/
00196 /*
00197  * this system is used to execute or initialize an operator,
00198  * using a formatted-string system.
00199  *
00200  * for example, BMO_op_callf(bm, "del geom=%hf context=%i", BM_ELEM_SELECT, DEL_FACES);
00201  * . . .will execute the delete operator, feeding in selected faces, deleting them.
00202  *
00203  * the basic format for the format string is:
00204  *   [operatorname] [slotname]=%[code] [slotname]=%[code]
00205  *
00206  * as in printf, you pass in one additional argument to the function
00207  * for every code.
00208  *
00209  * the formatting codes are:
00210  *    %d - put int in slot
00211  *    %f - put float in slot
00212  *    %p - put pointer in slot
00213  *    %h[f/e/v] - put elements with a header flag in slot.
00214  *                 the letters after %h define which element types to use,
00215  *             so e.g. %hf will do faces, %hfe will do faces and edges,
00216  *             %hv will do verts, etc.  must pass in at least one
00217  *             element type letter.
00218  *    %H[f/e/v] - same as %h, but tests if the flag is disabled
00219  *    %f[f/e/v] - same as %h, except it deals with tool flags instead of
00220  *                 header flags.
00221  *    %F[f/e/v] - same as %f, but tests if the flag is disabled
00222  *    %a[f/e/v] - pass all elements (of types specified by f/e/v) to the
00223  *                 slot.
00224  *    %e        - pass in a single element.
00225  *    %v - pointer to a float vector of length 3.
00226  *    %m[3/4] - matrix, 3/4 refers to the matrix size, 3 or 4.  the
00227  *              corresponding argument must be a pointer to
00228  *          a float matrix.
00229  *    %s - copy a slot from another op, instead of mapping to one
00230  *         argument, it maps to two, a pointer to an operator and
00231  *     a slot name.
00232  */
00233 void BMO_push(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op);
00234 void BMO_pop(BMesh *bm);
00235 
00236 /*executes an operator*/
00237 int BMO_op_callf(BMesh *bm, const char *fmt, ...);
00238 
00239 /* initializes, but doesn't execute an operator.  this is so you can
00240  * gain access to the outputs of the operator.  note that you have
00241  * to execute/finitsh (BMO_op_exec and BMO_op_finish) yourself. */
00242 int BMO_op_initf(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op, const char *fmt, ...);
00243 
00244 /* va_list version, used to implement the above two functions,
00245  * plus EDBM_op_callf in editmesh_utils.c. */
00246 int BMO_op_vinitf(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op, const char *fmt, va_list vlist);
00247

00249 int BMO_slot_exists(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname);

00251 /* get a pointer to a slot.  this may be removed layer on from the public API. */
00252 BMOpSlot *BMO_slot_get(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname);

00254 /* copies the data of a slot from one operator to another.  src and dst are the
00255  * source/destination slot codes, respectively. */
00256 void BMO_slot_copy(BMOperator *source_op, BMOperator *dest_op,
00257                    const char *src, const char *dst);

00280 /* don't pass in arrays that are supposed to map to elements this way.
00281  *
00282  * so, e.g. passing in list of floats per element in another slot is bad.
00283  * passing in, e.g. pointer to an editmesh for the conversion operator is fine
00284  * though. */
00285 void  BMO_slot_ptr_set(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname, void *p);
00286 void *BMO_slot_ptr_get(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname);
00287 void  BMO_slot_vec_set(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname, const float vec[3]);
00288 void  BMO_slot_vec_get(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname, float r_vec[3]);

00290 /* only supports square mats */
00291 /* size must be 3 or 4; this api is meant only for transformation matrices.
00292  * note that internally the matrix is stored in 4x4 form, and it's safe to
00293  * call whichever BMO_Get_Mat* function you want. */
00294 void BMO_slot_mat_set(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname, const float *mat, int size);
00295 void BMO_slot_mat4_get(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname, float r_mat[4][4]);
00296 void BMO_slot_mat3_set(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname, float r_mat[3][3]);

00353 /* flags all elements in a mapping.  note that the mapping must only have
00354  * bmesh elements in it.*/
00355 void BMO_slot_map_to_flag(BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op, const char *slotname,
00356                           const char hflag, const short oflag);
00357 
00358 /* this part of the API is used to iterate over element buffer or
00359  * mapping slots.
00360  *
00361  * for example, iterating over the faces in a slot is:
00362  *
00363  *    BMOIter oiter;
00364  *    BMFace *f;
00365  *
00366  *    f = BMO_iter_new(&oiter, bm, some_operator, "slotname", BM_FACE);
00367  *    for (; f; f = BMO_iter_step(&oiter)) {
00368  *        /do something with the face
00369  *    }
00370  *
00371  * another example, iterating over a mapping:
00372  *    BMOIter oiter;
00373  *    void *key;
00374  *    void *val;
00375  *
00376  *    key = BMO_iter_new(&oiter, bm, some_operator, "slotname", 0);
00377  *    for (; key; key = BMO_iter_step(&oiter)) {
00378  *        val = BMO_iter_map_value(&oiter);
00379  *        //do something with the key/val pair
00380  *        //note that val is a pointer to the val data,
00381  *        //whether it's a float, pointer, whatever.
00382  *        //
00383  *        // so to get a pointer, for example, use:
00384  *        //  *((void**)BMO_iter_map_value(&oiter));
00385  *        //or something like that.
00386  *    }
00387  */
00388 
00389 /* contents of this structure are private,
00390  * don't directly access. */
00391 typedef struct BMOIter {
00392     BMOpSlot *slot;
00393     int cur; //for arrays
00394     GHashIterator giter;
00395     void *val;
00396     char restrictmask; /* bitwise '&' with BMHeader.htype */
00397 } BMOIter;
00398 
00399 void *BMO_slot_buffer_elem_first(BMOperator *op, const char *slotname);
00400 
00401 void *BMO_iter_new(BMOIter *iter, BMesh *bm, BMOperator *op,
00402                    const char *slotname, const char restrictmask);
00403 void *BMO_iter_step(BMOIter *iter);
00404 
00405 /* returns a pointer to the key value when iterating over mappings.
00406  * remember for pointer maps this will be a pointer to a pointer.*/
00407 void *BMO_iter_map_value(BMOIter *iter);
00408 
00409 /* use this for pointer mappings */
00410 void *BMO_iter_map_value_p(BMOIter *iter);
00411 
00412 /* use this for float mappings */
00413 float BMO_iter_map_value_f(BMOIter *iter);
00414 
00415 #define BMO_ITER(ele, iter, bm, op, slotname, restrict)   \
00416     for (ele = BMO_iter_new(iter, bm, op, slotname, restrict); ele; ele = BMO_iter_step(iter))

00422  * follows the mapping struct in memory. */
